books.title: New Grub Street
books.author: George Gissing
books.summary: A group of writers try to hold on to artistic merit in the face of abject poverty in the quickly changing literary and social landscape of Victorian London.

books.title: The Child of the Cavern
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: An engineer returns to a depleted coal mine at an old friend’s request and investigates mysterious happenings.

books.title: An Autobiography
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: The autobiography of American President Theodore Roosevelt.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Enchanted Castle
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Three children discover a wonderful garden and castle, and come into possession of a magic ring which entangles them in many strange adventures.

books.title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
books.author: Anita Loos
books.summary: The comic diary of a young woman recounting her escapades and romances in 1920s New York and Europe.

books.title: Henry VIII
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Henry VIII plans to divorce his first wife for Anne Bullen.

books.title: Lilith
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: After inheriting his ancestral home, a young man discovers another world inside his library and embarks on an allegorical journey.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: The Poisoned Chocolates Case
books.author: Anthony Berkeley
books.summary: A club of amateur sleuths attempts to solve a crime whose solution has eluded Scotland Yard.

books.title: Liberalism
books.author: L. T. Hobhouse
books.summary: An early twentieth century description of the philosophy of liberal socialism.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A collection of Ambrose Bierce’s poetry.

books.title: Evelina
books.author: Fanny Burney
books.summary: A young woman navigates the absurdities of 18th-century English society, fends off various suitors, and attempts to establish her true parentage.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Poul Anderson
books.summary: A collection of science fiction short stories by Poul Anderson ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Leonid Andreyev
books.summary: A collection of Leonid Andreyev’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
